title: AN IMPOSSIBLY NORMAL LIFE
description: Four years ago, my mother offhandedly mentioned that I had an uncle who may have been gay, but he died soon after I was born. Hearing this thirty years after I had struggled to come out to my disapproving family sent my mind spinning. The thought of a family member going through some of the same things I did inspired m

title: AGAINST THE GRAIN
description: Photographer Mark Maio devoted more than three decades to create the images that document the last years of a tough-minded gang of Great Lakes union men that celled themselves Scoopers. They operated in groups of eighteen, referred to as gangs, and their primary responsibility was to unload large grain-hauling vessels

title: THIRTY-ONE DAYS
description: During the final month in and around his childhood home, Christopher Lowell photographs a distinct portrait of the American South; a landscape as true as it is mythical. In Lowell’s interpretation, singular moments are made infinite. Bodies leap off roofs and fall from trees, suspended in permanent flight. The smoke fr

title: COVID DIARY
description: COVID Diary is one photographer’s tale of processing the COVID-19 pandemic through the lens of her camera. This unique book, one part diary and one part art exhibit allows a glimpse into Beth Galton’s life, thoughts, and art process as New York City weathered the storm of the global pandemic.While the news was everywhe
